keyword: how many calories in a taco bell chicken quesadilla
title: How Many Calories in a Taco Bell Chicken Quesadilla?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a Taco Bell chicken quesadilla, including full nutrition breakdown, macros, sodium, and preparation tweaks for your meal planning.
h1: How Many Calories in a Taco Bell Chicken Quesadilla?
assumptions: Standard Taco Bell menu item: flour tortilla, grilled chicken, three-cheese blend, creamy jalapeño sauce; as served without modifications.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by location, customizations, portion size, and preparation; check Taco Bell app or website for latest values.

quick_answer.text: A Taco Bell chicken quesadilla contains about 510 calories and 27 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with menu info.

tweaks.label: Fresco style (no cheese or sauce, add pico de gallo)

faqs.q: How many calories in a Taco Bell chicken quesadilla?
faqs.a: Approximately 510 calories for the standard version.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a Taco Bell chicken quesadilla?
faqs.a: About 27 g of protein per quesadilla.

faqs.q: How much sodium is in a Taco Bell chicken quesadilla?
faqs.a: Around 1260 mg, mostly from cheese and sauce.

faqs.q: Are there carbs in a Taco Bell chicken quesadilla?
faqs.a: Yes, about 47 g total carbs, including 3 g fiber from the tortilla.

faqs.q: Can I make a Taco Bell chicken quesadilla lower calorie?
faqs.a: Opt for no sauce or fresco style to reduce by 50–150 calories.
